title: clear up several more inconsistencies among `gcd` , `gcdx` and `invmod`

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: This change fixes an existing bug

body:
fixes some bad behavior in `gcdx` where it would return nonpositive `gcd`:
```
julia> gcdx(typemin(Int8), typemin(Int8)) 
(-128, 0, -1)
```

thereby exposing new issues in `invmod` which had previously worked around these inconsistencies.

this PR makes that above example an error
```
julia> gcdx(typemin(Int8), typemin(Int8)) 
ERROR: OverflowError: checked arithmetic: cannot compute |x| for x = -128::Int8
```

but also fixes cases like
```
julia> gcdx(typemin(Int8), Int8(-1))
(1, 0, -1)

julia> gcd(typemin(Int8), UInt16(2))
0x0002
```

which currently error on master.

also fixes several correctness issues with `invmod`, one random example: `invmod(0x3e81, Int16(-5716))`

the policy I'm targeting --- doesn't have to be publicly documented / promised I guess, but it's probably good to at least have an internal definition is:

for all of `gcd`, `gcdx`, `lcm`, `invmod`
* if for `T = promote_typeof(a, b)`, `signed(T)` cannot fit `abs(a)` and `abs(b)`, then we obtain an error (ideally map to `DomainError`, but currently is `InexactError`)
* the computation is returned in `T`, implying that if the correct value should be `abs(typemin(T))` and `T` is signed, we must error. again, this would ideally be a `DomainError` but is currently a mix of `DivideError` and `OverflowError`

otherwise, all the normal rules for these functions must hold:
* `gcd(a, b) == gcdx(a, b)[1]`
* `gcd` and `gcdx[1]` are positive
* `d, u, v = gcdx(a, b)` must satisfy `d == u * a + v * b` modulo `T` possibly with overflow
* `i = invmod(x, m)` must satisfy `mod(1, m) == mod(widemul(x, i), m)`
* return sign of `invmod` follows the same conventions as the sign of `mod`

and any inputs that do not error must return a correct value.
